Package de.oth.blocklib.entities.billboards

Class Billboard

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.entities.billboards.Billboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
TextBillboard
public class Billboard
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable, java.io.Serializable
This class enables the possibility to draw billboards (textured quads that are always turned towards the Camera) into the world. Billboards need a Texture, a scale and a world position. The axis around which the billboard will rotate can be defined by limitRotationAxes() By calling the methods show() and hide() the billboard will be shown or hidden.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • limitRotationAxes

      public void limitRotationAxes​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f rotationAxes)
      Sets the axes around which the object is supposed to rotate. Set any axis to 1 for having it move around that axis, and 1 to only rotate around that axis. Setting 2 axes to 1 will lead to the object not being able to rotate, but still showing it's front face to the player. WARNING: If the X and Z axes (1,0,1) are selected, it will lead to an error because of the way lookAt() works. WARNING: Setting 3 axes to 1 will lead to an error. Leave at least one axis rotateable.
      Parameters:
      rotationAxes - setting the Axes to limit the movement to

    • calculateFacingPoint

      private void calculateFacingPoint()
      Facing point is calculated for each axis. If an axis is set to 1, the object will not turn around this axis by having the facing point on the position of the object itself.
